conclusion: To determine whether Car A is ahead of or behind Car B at t=30s, we need to analyze the velocity-time graphs of both cars.
Graph A represents Car A's velocity-time graph.
Graph B represents Car B's velocity-time graph.
At t=30s, both graphs intersect at the same point, indicating that at this time, both cars are moving at the same velocity.
At t=10s, Car A is moving at a velocity of 40 m/s.
At t=10s, Car B is moving at a velocity of 0 m/s (since it has not started moving yet).
At t=20s, Car A has moved for 10 seconds and is moving at a velocity of 40 m/s.
At t=20s, Car B has moved for 10 seconds and is moving at a velocity of 0 m/s.
At t=30s, both graphs intersect again, indicating that at this time, both cars are moving at the same velocity.
At t=30s, both Car A and Car B are moving at the same velocity of 40 m/s.
Since the question asks whether Car A is ahead of or behind Car B at t=30s, and both cars are moving at the same velocity, Car A is not ahead of or behind Car B at t=30s.
